Author/Title Index: B

A B C D E F G H IJ K L M N O P Q R S T U V W X Z
Collapse All | Expand All
  • Master B. [late 13th cent.]
    1 catalogue entry (1 book).
    • Aggregationes de crisi et de creticis diebus et de prognosticationeed. C. O'Boyle, Medieval Prognosis and Astrology (Cambridge 1991); Thorndike/Kibre 204. [Master B in the oldest manuscripts, including UO6.136; in later copies expanded to Mr Bartholomew or Mr Bernard of Poitiers and later, anachronistically, equated with Bartholomoew of Bruges.]
      Catalogue entryCatalogue
      UO6.*36x UNIVERSITY AND COLLEGE LIBRARIES OF OXFORD: All Souls College: Inventory of the library, c. 1443
  • Babio : ed. A. D. Fulgheri in Commedie latine, 2. 129–301; ed. A. K. Bate, Three Latin Comedies (Toronto 1976), 35–60.
    1 catalogue entry.
    • Catalogue entryCatalogue
      BA1.1480e (`libellus de babione') BENEDICTINES: Canterbury-St Augustine's: Catalogue, 15th cent.

  • Baudri de Bourgueil [c1046–1130], archbishop of Dol
    1 catalogue entry (1 book).
    • (ascr.; ps. Augustine), De uisitatione infirmorum: PL 40. 1147–58; CPPM 2. 3082; Römer, 2/1. 199. [Usually transmitted as Augustine (q. v.), but three copies, all English, have preserved an ascription to Baudri.]

      A20.*214c (`Baldericus de consolacione mortis') AUGUSTINIAN CANONS: Leicester: Catalogue, 15th cent.

  • Baldwin of Ford OCist [†1190], archbishop of Canterbury
    28 catalogue entries (9 books).
    • Carmen deuotionis: not known to survive.
      Catalogue entryCatalogue
      B45.11b BENEDICTINES: THE SHORTER CATALOGUES: Glastonbury: Bale, c. 1550
    • Commentary on Kings: attested by Leland on doubtful evidence. Noted by Leland from BC4 and apparently interpreted by him as a commentary by Baldwin rather than as a copy of Kings and Chronicles given to the priory by Baldwin.

    • De temporibus: CPL 2318; ed. C. W. Jones, CCSL 123C (1980) 585–611. [The same title is also used to refer to Bede, De temporum ratione (CPL 2320), and unconfirmed entries may be either work; where there is some corroboration, it always points to De temporum ratione, though sometimes manuscript catalogues have simply accepted the medieval title and not confirmed the text, e.g. James, St John's, 31. The cumulative indexing has led to reassignment of identifications in a number of cases.]
      Catalogue entryCatalogue

    • Meditationes seu Lamentationes peccatorum → Bernard ps. Planctus Mariae
    • Meditationes super passionem Domini nostri → Bonaventure ps.
    • Planctus Mariae: pr. [Cologne c. 1470] (GW 4055); ed. C. W. Marx in JMLat 4 (1994) 118–29; H. Barré in Revue d'ascétique et de mystique 28 (1952) 245–66. The text is a widely circulating extract from Oglerio of Locedio's De laudibus sanctae Dei genitricis (ed. J. B. Adriani (Turin 1893)). [For the incipit Quis dabit capiti meo aquam [Ier 9:1], Bloomfield 4839 gives only two copies, though there are very many.]

    • Meditationes de passione Christi: ed. M. Stallings (Washington, DC, 1965); Distelbrink 164. [The text is a part of the Meditationes uitae Christi attributed to Iohannes de Caulibus, but the text as edited represents a 16th-cent. recension. The edition appeared under the name Sr M. Jordan Stallings; her 1997 edition of the work of Iohannes appeared under the name C. Mary Stallings-Taney and represents a very different perspective on the text.]
